rmp.university: University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill
comments: I didn't like her at first - I mistook her businesslike efficiency for condescension, but her brilliance and thoughtfulness grew on me (think Professor McGonagall!). I had no interest in Classics before taking this class, but learned more than I ever thought I would about Western history, art, philosophy and morality.

Hilariously difficult, patronizing, and humiliating. Her criticism is so unnecessarily rude that her point often gets lost. My class was only a first-year seminar, but it's been my hardest this semester. Unless you're very, very serious about learning Classics, avoid this professor. Not worth your time.

I had no interest in this subject before I took this class and was really dreading it, but she made it incredibly interesting, one of the best classes I've taken at UNC. Tests are a LOT of writing and require a pretty good grasp of the material.
